value: Rensselaer is a school described in Section 170(b)(1(A)(ii) and checked box 2 on Schedul A, Part I on the current year and previously filed Form 990 returns. Instructions for Form 990, Part IV, line 2 requires an organization to answer "Yes" if it meets the 33 1/3% support test of the requlations under sections 509(a)(1) and 170(b)(1)(A)(vi), checks the box on Schedule A, Part II, line 13, 16a or 16b and received from any one contributor contributions of the greater of $5,000 or 2% of the amount on Part VIII, line 1h. Rensselaer meets this test and have answered "Yes" to Part IV, line 2 which requires completing Schedule B. Furthermore, the instructions states that an organization filing Schedule B can limit the contributors it reports on Schedule B to greater than 2% of the amount on Part VIII, line 1h only if it checks the box on Schedule A, Part II, line 13, 16a or 16b. However, the tax software that Rensslaer uses to prepare the Form 990 will not display Schedule A, Part II when box 2 is checked on Schedule A, Part I. To be compliant with the instructions for Form 990, Part IV, line 2, Rensselaer is submitting the completed Scheduel A, Part II as a separate attachment.

description: Part III contents; Form, Part and line number reference explanation
value: The President is the only employee eligible for first class and spousal/companion travel. Other executives may be approved based on medical documentation only. Rensselaer's President is allowed to use first class travel on Rensselaer business in accordance with the terms of her employment agreement, which was approved by independent members of the Compensation and Personnel Development Committee. The President's expenses are subject to review by the Board of Trustees, including any amounts for spousal or companion travel. The Board has oversight of strategic issues for facilities management, which include but are not limited to capital improvements and other costs for Rensselaer's presidential residence. The Board of Rensselaer also oversees the review and audit of expenses of the President relating to the presidential residence and personal services associated with the upkeep of the residence. Such review occurs under the Board's oversight on an at least annual basis.
